Class HexPaint

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  HexPaint
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class HexPaint
extends javax.swing.JPanel

COPYRIGHT (C) 2005 Rob Bauer. All Rights Reserved.

This is class recursively builds a hexagon fractal. It has setters in place to define additional features (such as drawing circles, using colors, and using different graphics classes).

The fractal level, starting at 0 is a fractal of just one hexagon. At level 1, there is one hexagon, at the user specified size, with 6 additional hexagons, at half the original size, around the first hexagon.

The Hexagon recursion model was based off of the SierpinskiGasket applet: http:// www.cs.uakron.edu/~kliszka/DSA2%20Fall%202005/SierpinskiGasket.java

Version:
1.0 2005-09-30
Author:
Rob Bauer
See Also:

Field Detail

serialVersionUID

private static final long serialVersionUID
See Also:
Constant Field Values

level

private int level
Fractal level the user selected

dimension

private int dimension
Dimension of the hexagon the user selected (in pixels). This is also the diameter of the circle the hexagon can fit into.

DSIN60

private final double DSIN60
Calculated value of sin(60 degrees) - the 60 degrees needs to be converted to radians. This value is used throughout the class to calculate the width of a hexagon.

drawmode

private int drawmode
Draw mode the user selected.
  • 0 = Use Graphics class (default)
  • 1 = Use Graphics2D class
  • 2 = Use both classes (draw twice

drawobject

private int drawobject
Draw object the user selected.
  • 0 = Hexagon (default)
  • 1 = Circle
  • 2 = Both, hexagon and circle

drawcolor

private int drawcolor
Draw color setting the user selected.
  • 0 = Black outline only (default)
  • 1 = Color each level
  • 2 = Color each level plus outline in black

color

private java.awt.Color[] color
Array of colors used to define the fractal level. The color to be selected is determined by the color element at the specified fractal level. The code will reuse colors if there is more fractal levels than colors.

paintComponent

public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
Paint the panel/component. This is where the fractal drawing begins.

Setup the panel, determine the drawing mode, then start the recursion.

Information on anitaliasing with Graphics2D: http://www.java2s.com/ExampleCode/2D-Graphics-GUI/AntiAlias.htm (by David Flanagan)

Overrides:
paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
See Also:
JComponent.paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics)

drawHexagon

private void drawHexagon(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                         int level,
                         int hexdistance,
                         double x,
                         double y)
Draw a hexagon. Determine if there's more hexagons to draw and draw them recursively.

A hexagon's location is determined by the given x and y coordinates. The hexagon is centered on those coodinates and drawn based on equilateral triangles. Each point of a hexagon touches the circle it fits into. The circle has a diameter the same as the hexdistance or dimension the user supplied. The hexagon also has 6 sides which are of the same distance. The distance is actually half the hexdistance or dimension, which is also the radius of the circle. The only unknown left is to determine the width of the hexagon. This can be found by calculating the radius times sin( 60 degrees ). The sin(60) calculation only needs to be performed once which takes place when the class is initialized. The method continues to draw fractals until the level reaches 0. Each new level causes the hexdistance to be halved. This also means the current radius is halved as well. These facts are used to produce one hexagon and, if necessary, its 6 neighbors.

Note: the Graphics2D class takes advantage of the Line2D.Double object. The hexagon is drawn using lines. I was not able to figure out a way to fill the hexagon in with color. If the user selects color from the preferences menu, the color option will be ignored for these hexagons. For color, use the Graphics class instead.

Parameters:
g - the Graphics2D class to use
level - the level to draw (user enters it as 0 based, but here it needs to be 1 based)
hexdistance - the diameter of the hexagon to draw (or the dimension)
x - the x-axis value to center the hexagon on
y - the y-axis value to center the hexagon on

drawHexagon

private void drawHexagon(java.awt.Graphics g,
                         int level,
                         int hexdistance,
                         int x,
                         int y)
Draw a hexagon. Determine if there's more hexagons to draw and draw them recursively.

A hexagon's location is determined by the given x and y coordinates. The hexagon is centered on those coodinates and drawn based on equilateral triangles. Each point of a hexagon touches the circle it fits into. The circle has a diameter the same as the hexdistance or dimension the user supplied. The hexagon also has 6 sides which are of the same distance. The distance is actually half the hexdistance or dimension, which is also the radius of the circle. The only unknown left is to determine the width of the hexagon. This can be found by calculating the radius times sin( 60 degrees ). The sin(60) calculation only needs to be performed once which takes place when the class is initialized. The method continues to draw fractals until the level reaches 0. Each new level causes the hexdistance to be halved. This also means the current radius is halved as well. These facts are used to produce one hexagon and, if necessary, its 6 neighbors.

Parameters:
g - the Graphics class to use
level - the level to draw (user enters it as 0 based, but here it needs to be 1 based)
hexdistance - the diameter of the hexagon to draw (or the dimension)
x - the x-axis value to center the hexagon on
y - the y-axis value to center the hexagon on
